ngiemboon: Yotam la gwaa néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ, ńgẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b ntʉ̂a né móm mbʉ́a, à la néŋe Yelúzálèm, ésáʼ ngwòŋ Yúndà na ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ né legém. Lezíŋ má we gẅie aa míŋ Sandɔg laa lê Yelúshÿà.
en: Jotham was twenty-five years old   when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.  # 27:1 2Ch 27:8 His mother’s name was Jerushah daughter of Zadok.

ngiemboon: Yotam la gÿo mmó gie á poŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ tá we Oziyásè. À la te láʼa lyɛ̌ʼ éfʉa lepʉ̌ ńkúu ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́. Táʼ, aláʼ ké ne ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á te Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé poŋ.
en: He did what was right in the Lord’s sight just as his father Uzziah had done. In addition, he didn’t enter the Lord’s sanctuary,   but the people still behaved corruptly.

ngiemboon: Yotam la nyɛte ncwò ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a we tÿǒ. À la nyɛte tʉ̂ankáʼ, á tsɛ̀ɛ lepfó sie mé tóŋ lê Ofɛɛ.
en: Jotham built the Upper Gate of the Lord’s temple, and he built extensively on the wall of Ophel.

ngiemboon: À la gíŋe ńkwɛ́ metÿǒsoŋ á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼ ye shÿó mekwɛ́ Yúndà, mbɔɔ metʉ̂ankáʼ lélɔg ńtÿɔ́ʼte, ńgÿo meshʉ̀shʉ̀a ndá ndêg tsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼ ye mbím.
en: He also built cities in the hill country of Judah and fortresses and towers in the forests.

ngiemboon: Yotam la gʉa ńdÿɔ́ʼ mefùɔ pʉ̀a Amoŋ tà ńjÿó. Á gwɔ́ na yɛ̌ ngùʼ, epʉ̀a Amoŋ péen ncùb mbwó yé, ńná nkáb metónà méntá, ńná ngesáŋ metónà ntsáʼ tá, ńgÿo metónà ngesáŋ ntsíŋ gie mé tóŋo lê ɔ̂ɔjÿè ntsáʼ tá. Pɔ́ la ké ḿbéen pɔ́ púʼu na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ pʉ́a mbɔɔ na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ tá.
en: He waged war against the king of the Ammonites. He overpowered the Ammonites, and that year they gave him 7,500 pounds   of silver, 60,000 bushels  # 27:5 Lit 10,000 cors of wheat, and 60,000 bushels of barley. They paid him the same in the second and third years.

ngiemboon: Yotam la cʉ́ʼʉ nɔ̀ɔn gwankÿo, mélàʼmie à la ne ńgiŋe ndʉŋndʉŋ na mekwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé ye.
en: So Jotham strengthened his position because he did not waver in obeying   the Lord his God.  # 27:6 2Ch 26:5

ngiemboon: Apfwɔ̀ʼɔ píte menò Yotam, mencù mie à la lÿɔ́ʼ, mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à la gÿo, áa ye ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne mefàʼ mefùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ, mbɔɔ pe Yúndà.
en: As for the rest of the events   of Jotham’s reign, along with all his wars and his ways, note that they are written in the Book of the Kings of Israel and Judah.

ngiemboon: Yotam la gwaa néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ, ńgẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b tʉ̂a né móm mbʉ́a, à la néŋe Yelúzálèm, ésáʼ ngwòŋ Yúndà na ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ né legém.
en: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Yotam la kwé, mé túŋo yé á jʉʼʉ mesyè tsìŋendá yɔ́b, á Yelúzálèm, á jʉʼ gie mé tóŋ lê tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ Ndavîd. Míŋ we Akaze jÿó ndá ye ńcʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ.
en: Jotham rested with his ancestors and was buried in the city of David. His son Ahaz became king in his place.
